page.title: 02A LOCAL FARM (PART 1)
page.content: SOME FIRST YEAR PUPILS FROM RYEISH GREEN SCHOOL WENT TO MAYS FARM,A DAIRY FARM IN HYDE END LANE,AND INTERVIEWED THE FARMER.THE PUPILS FOUND OUT THAT THE SIZE OF THE FARM WAS 107 ACRES, AND BETWEEN APRIL AND SEPTEMBER EVERY YEAR HE RENTS ANOTHER 31 ACRES. HE HAS THREE TRACTORS WHICH COST BETWEEN Â£8,000 AND Â£20,000,THREE TRAILERS,A BALER,A HAYTEDDER,A MOWER,A ROTOR SPREADER,A SCRAPER,A BALE COLLECTOR,A BALE GRAB,A BALE ELEVATOR, AND A FERTILISER SPREADER.HE IS THE ONLY WORKER ON THE FARM.THERE ARE THREE MAIN BUILDINGS ON THE FARM:THE COW SHED,THE DAIRY AND THE CALVING SHED.HE GROWS GRASS,STUBBLE TURNIP AND KALE WHICH ARE ALL FODDER CROPS.HE GROWS THE STUBBLE TURNIP AND THE KALE TO STOP THE PROBLEM OF LACK OF GRASS THAT HE HAS HAD IN THE PREVIOUS TWO YEARS.
